name: Angled Side Bridge
preparation: Place forearm on padded elevated surface, positioned perpendicular to body. Position feet out away from elevated surface, one foot in front of other with hips and knees straight. Place free hand on upper hip and allow lower hip and waist to bend downward.
execution: Raise hips upward by lateral flexion of spine. Lower to original position and repeat. Repeat with opposite side.
comments: One of very few body weight exercises that directly exercises side deltoid in relatively full range of motion. In addition to lateral flexion of spine, lower hip abducts and upper hip adducts. See Spot Reduction Myth. Easier
synergists: adductors, trapeziusmiddle, tensorfasciaelatae, gluteusmaximus, erectorspinae, pectineus, gluteusminimus, deltoidlateral, supraspinatus, trapeziuslower, levatorscapulae, iliopsoas, quadratuslumborum, gracilis, serratusanterior, gluteusmedius

name: Standing Brachioradialis Stretch
preparation: Cross wrists, point thumbs downward, and clasp hands.
execution: Straighten arms and externally rotate shoulders by back. Hold stretch.
comments: Wrist Extensors can also be stretched in this position by flexing forward wrist so hands bend toward side of forward arm. The arm can be crossed to stretch opposite wrist.
